All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Removal of news media outlets from Pentagon spaces (Department of Defense, Office of the Secretary of Defense)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All records pertaining to the decision (or bases for the decision) identified in the January 31, 2025, memo entitled "New Annual Media Rotation Program for Pentagon Press Corps."

2. All policies, guidelines, or standards employed in identifying which outlet will be permitted to use the physical offices in the Pentagon.

3. Any communications to or from John Ullyot between January 20, 2025, and January 31, 2025, pertaining to news media or the physical offices.

I request that this request be expedited. I am primarily engaged in disseminating information because I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and press freedom, including on the public website for the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. This information is urgently needed in order to inform the public concerning an actual government activity, namely the Pentagon's allocation of physical spaces to particular news media outlets. This information concerns a breaking news story of general public interest.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.communication:

All documents on Jenoptik (https://www.jenoptik.com/markets/public-safety) including, but not limited to, the following:

- Initial Bid Documents
- Current and previous contracts with Jenoptik
- Requests for Proposals
- Memorandum(s) of Understanding
- Any privacy impact assessments
- Any product manuals
- Any instructional materials or presentations
- Use policies and standard operating procedures
- Data retention policies
- Letters of Interest

- Any informal agreements or other documents that reference "Jenoptik" or otherwise guide it use or the relationship between this agency and the provider or developer of the product(s)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

title: Palm Beach Networks (Palm Beach Sheriff's Office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The requested records are all those, for the period between January 1, 2022 and the date on which this request is processed, describing and relating to the relationship between this agency and Defense Prime Inc. or Palm Beach Networks, Inc.  and any relationships between any representative of either entity.
Responsive records include, but are not limited to, the following:
• All documents concerning or mentioning Defense Prime, Inc. Or Palm Beach Networks Inc. and any representative thereof, including all documentation on any service or software provided by or created by Defense Prime, Inc. or Palm Beach Networks, Inc.
CONTRACT AND AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, memorandums of understanding, and any other written agreements between this agency and Defense Prime, Inc. or Palm Beach Networks, Inc. including all associated amendments, exhibits, and supplemental and supporting documentation.
FINANCIAL MATERIALS
• All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the relationship between the aforementioned entities. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format. This also includes any Requests for Proposal and bidding materials provided by Defense Prime, Inc. or Palm Beach Networks, Inc. and any other entities responding to the same Request for Proposal or equivalent procurement request.
MARKETING and PROMOTION MATERIALS
• All promotional, descriptive, and marketing materials in the possession of this agency related to and/or referencing Defense Prime, Inc. or Palm Beach Networks, Inc. This includes all presentations, marketing materials, technical documentation, proposals, or similar records shared with this agency and/or any representative thereof by Defense Prime, Inc. or Palm Beach Networks, Inc. and/or any representative thereof.
GUIDING DOCUMENTATION and POLICIES
• All policies, memorandums of understanding, and other guidance materials generated by this agency and/or any entity operating on its behalf or to its benefit (including, but not limited to, any unions, community groups, other government agencies, or individuals) regarding the acquisition and use of any data or services provided by Defense Prime, Inc. or Palm Beach Networks, Inc.
 or any subdivision thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to, any data-sharing agreements, terms of use, licensing agreements, and any other guiding materials.
• All user manuals, other guidance materials, help documents, or related materials obtained from Defense Prime, Inc. or Palm Beach Networks, Inc.
COMMUNICATIONS
• All written communications, emails, and attachments between this agency and any representative thereof and Defense Prime, Inc. or Palm Beach Networks, Inc.
 and any representative thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to all written communications, emails, and attachments containing and/or referencing any of the following terms:
Defense Prime
Palm Beach Networks

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Cooper Quintin

title: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing the  Face Recognition System

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing the  Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to learn: 1) which local, state and national law enforcement agencies can currently submit probe photos to be run through the Northeast Ohio Regional Fusion Center's face recognition system, and 2) which law enforcement agencies actually submitted probe photo(s)  for a search from January 1, 2023 to the date of the most recently available data.

Please provide any lists, logs, datasets, documents or policies showing this information.  With regard to agencies that have submitted probe photos, please provide logs, lists or datasets describing, as available, the requesting organization, the number of requests made, the dates of the requests, and the number of requests granted.  If this information is maintained in a spreadsheet, such as Excel, I request that the record be produced in this format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

title: USS Liberty: Copy of DoD Mandated Investigation of “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967”

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USS Liberty: Copy of DoD Mandated Investigation of “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967”
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am a survivor of the June 8, 1967 Israeli attack on the USS Liberty and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association. [https://ussliberty.com]

On June 8, 2005 the USS Liberty Veterans Association submitted “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967” to the Secretary of the Army in his capacity as Executive Agent for the Secretary of Defense. 

A copy of that report is at https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25497919-war-crimes-report-with-exhibits/.

The Department of Defense Law of War Manual requires “DoD policy has required that the commander of any unit that obtains information about a reportable incident shall immediately report the incident through the applicable operational command and Military Department.” [Paragraph 18.13.2, DoD Law of War Manual Page 1100]

The footnote on page 1100 states in part, “All reportable incidents committed by or against U.S. personnel, enemy persons, or any other individual are reported promptly, investigated thoroughly, and, where appropriate, remedied by corrective action.”

The DoD Law of War Manual is at https://dod.defense.gov/Portals/1/Documents/pubs/DoD%20Law%20of%20War%20Manual%20-%20June%202015%20Updated%20Dec%202016.pdf.

An excerpt of the relevant passage in the Law of War Manual is attached.

A reportable incident committed against U.S. personnel was reported to the Flag and other high-ranking US Navy officers serving on the US Navy Court of Inquiry when USS Liberty survivor Lloyd Painter testified under oath during the US Navy Court of Inquiry that he witnessed the IDF torpedo boats deliberately machine gunning of life rafts we had dropped over the side in anticipation of abandoning ship.

Upon receiving a copy of the US Navy Court of Inquiry Report, Painter noted that the portion of his testimony referenced above does not appear in the Report of the Court.

In his sworn deposition, Painter writes:

“1515 Hours: I climbed the ladder and opened the hatch to the main deck. I wanted to see if it was safe enough to bring the wounded sailors out onto the main deck. What I saw sent ice running through my veins. The life rafts were either destroyed or had been cut loose and had floated away. I personally observed an Israeli MTB methodically machine gun one of the Liberty's empty life rafts that had been cut loose and was floating in the water. I knew at that split second that the thrust of the IDF attack was to kill every American sailor on board. There were to be no survivors that day. I decided to leave all of the wounded sailors below decks for some measure of protection. I did not prepare to abandon ship.”

We have attached a complete copy of Lloyd Painter’s sworn deposition to this request.

We are requesting a copy of the investigation of the War Crimes investigation that is mandated by the Department of Defense Manual.

We are further requesting a copy of all records related to or mentioning our submission of “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967”

WE ARE NOT ASKING FOR ANOTHER COPY OF A US NAVY COURT OF INQUIRY REPORT BUT FOR THE REPORT OF THE MANDATED INVESTIGATION, CONDUCTED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOD LAW OF WAR MANUAL, ESTABLISHED TO INVESTIGATE AND RESOLVE THE ALLEGATIONS CONTAINED IN OUR WAR CRIMES REPORT WHICH WE SUBMITTED TO THE DOD ON JUNE 8, 2005.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

communications.communication:

YOU DO NOT NEED TO ASK ME IF I WANT YOU TO PREPARE A COST ESTIMATE IF THERE IS ONE

For the 2023 - 24 and current academic year to date copies of the Corps weekly training schedule/matrix/duty schedules and or other records showing all military and other duty for the Corps of Cadets. A copy of one such record is attached. Based on my knowledge and belief this record consists of an excel spreadsheet including, at a minimum tabs covering  Master Schedule, Information Annex, Activities Annex, Athletics Annex.

Sincerely,

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Riverside County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts, and seizures made by the department, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the department receives a share under the MOUs the department has in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided.

- Records and data that outlines what was purchased using money from the fund, including dates, descriptions, and total spent. 

- Any annual reports produced civil asset forfeiture program.

- Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the department Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the department

- Sales of non-monetary assets, receipts of sale for vehicles, or the destruction of other non-monetary assets

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.
 
The period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Preferably released in .CSV form when possible

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

The period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Preferably released in .CSV form when possible

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Case, disciplinary or other records
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,
Insofar as some of these are open/pending investigations, we would have no responsive public records.
A number of these cases/investigations are being conducted outside our jurisdiction, as such we would have no responsive public records.
Finally, as regard pending prosecutions, we anticipate it will take us well over five hours to review each case to determine whether we have responsive records and then to review/redact same.  We charge $50/hour for labor.  Because we do not have the staff to devote such time to one request, we would have to work on this piecemeal. Accordingly, we can begin with the first 5 hours of this project and the cost of this labor will be $250 (made payable in advance of the work being commenced).  If you would like to proceed this way, please send me a check, made payable to the State Attorney's Office, in the amount of $250 and we will get started upon receipt of same.  Due to the various other requests we process daily, completion of this labor should occur within two to three weeks after payment is received.

title: Request to Department of Homeland Security for Multimedia Agreements for 2018

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Department of Homeland Security for Multimedia Agreements for 2018
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All DHS Multimedia Agreements signed by the Department of Homeland Security for the year 2018.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo
